intro: Paepalanthus pubescens var. chapadensis, commonly known as the Chapada velvetleaf, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, broad leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks. It has a woody stem and produces capsule fruits that contain small, oval seeds. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and an attraction for pollinators.
